abstract: In an effort to rush through thousands of home foreclosures since 2007, financial institutions and their mortgage-servicing departments hired hair stylists, Wal-Mart floor workers and people who had worked on assembly lines and installed them in “foreclosure expert” jobs with no formal training, a Florida lawyer said.
snippet: In an effort to rush through thousands of home foreclosures since 2007, financial institutions and their mortgage-servicing departments hired hair stylists, Wal-Mart floor workers and people who had worked on assembly lines and installed them in “...
lead_paragraph: In an effort to rush through thousands of home foreclosures since 2007, financial institutions and their mortgage-servicing departments hired hair stylists, Wal-Mart floor workers and people who had worked on assembly lines and installed them in “foreclosure expert” jobs with no formal training, a Florida lawyer says.

abstract: Irish Nationwide’s bondholders are looking to unite in defiance of the losses they may be forced to take as the government pushes ahead with restructuring, The Financial Times reports.
snippet: Irish Nationwide’s bondholders are looking to unite in defiance of the losses they may be forced to take as the government pushes ahead with restructuring, The Financial Times reports.
lead_paragraph: Bondholders of Irish Nationwide are looking to unite in defiance of the losses they may be forced to take as the Irish government pushes ahead with its restructuring of the mortgage lender, The Financial Times reports.
